Description: Wooden female figure: a representation a nonroyal woman standing with her open hands at her sides and her left leg advanced. The skirt of her traditional tight dress is stretched between her legs; the two straps would have been indicated in paint. The legs are broken away.
Curator's comments: The small size of this figure and the fact that it was made in wood suggest that it is a rare Late Period tomb statue. Bibliography: S. Albersmeier, Untersuchungen zu den Frauenstatuen des ptolemäischen Ägypten (Mainz am Rhein, 2002), 65 n. 393; 159 n. 34.
Bibliographic references: Russmann 2001 / Eternal Egypt: Masterworks of Ancient Art from the British Museum (137)
Exhibition history: 2012 23 March - 23 July 2012, Musee Jaquemart Andre, Paris, Le Crepuscule des Pharaons
